newsitem.title: USA: AIG offers policy for aircraft part makers.
newsitem.headline: AIG offers policy for aircraft part makers.

text.p: American International Group Inc said its member companies will offer a property-casualty insurance package for aircraft component parts manufacturers and service providers.

The package, called Aeroparts+, is targeted to insureds with both aircraft product and non-aircraft product exposures, such as metals, plastics and electronics manufacturers, as well as providers of manuals, procedures and testing.
The policy provides aircraft products and grounding liability and non-aviation general liability coverages.
Insureds also can package Aeroparts+ with property coverage.
Limits of liability are available up to $50 million. Coverage is underwritten by AIG member companies.
Aeroparts+ will be offered through AIG's domestic regional company network.

"Manufacturers and service providers with both aviation and non-aviation product exposures have been confined to purchasing general liability, aircraft products liability and property coverages on separate policies and usually from different carriers," Theodore Rupley, chairman of AIG domestic regional company network said in a statement.
"Aeroparts+ enables these companies to consolidate these coverages with one package, with the added benefit of working with a local representative from an AIG regional company," he said.
